author: wsjcom
title: What Does ‘Fixing the NCAA’ Really Mean?
text:
Regarding William McGurn’s “The NCAA Cannot Fix College Sports” (Main Street, March 13): The Board of the National Collegiate Athletic Association is comprised entirely of university presidents, so the idea that it is somehow disconnected from academic control is incorrect.
Most of the broadcasting money flows through the conferences, not the NCAA, which is limited to its contract for March Madness and the Final Four. The major revenue conferences have revenue far in excess of the NCAA, so the idea that the Big Ten, for instance,...
